news_header: A pub manager in Chelmsford reports a quiet January due to the cost-of-living crisis, with concerns about the future of the hospitality industry as costs rise and consumer spending declines.
news_text: Willow Gwyn-Williams, a 23-year-old pub manager, notes that January is unusually quiet for her pub, attributing the downturn to the cost-of-living crisis. Videos of empty bars are trending on TikTok, highlighting the struggles of hospitality workers. The sector anticipates ongoing challenges due to rising costs from increased National Insurance contributions and minimum wage, leading to potential job cuts and closures. Industry leaders are worried about the future, with many businesses needing to raise prices to survive. Despite discounts and promotions, consumers are expected to spend less on hospitality in early 2025, with recovery dependent on falling essential costs.
